abstract: Workers digging below Washington Square Park in preparation to install new water main encounter two stone and brick burial chambers dating to early 1800s and strewn with human remains and coffins in various states of preservation; identification plates on coffins are expected to provide archaeologists with valuable trove of information about history of residents of Lower Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Construction on a new water main in Lower Manhattan uncovered two forgotten burial vaults, whose contents and histories are still unknown to archaeologists.

headline.main: Beneath Washington Square, Forgotten Tombs Begin to Yield Their Secrets
headline.print_headline: Beneath Washington Square, Forgotten Tombs Begin to Yield Their Secrets

snippet: Construction on a new water main in Lower Manhattan uncovered two forgotten burial vaults, whose contents and histories are still unknown to archaeologists.
